VFETribals.CornerstoneDef.label: Travelers in Silence
VFETribals.CornerstoneDef.blurb: The people of {0} chart the safest and most hidden routes, and know never to make a sound when traveling.

VFETribals.CornerstoneDef.label: Agents of Ruin
VFETribals.CornerstoneDef.description: Damage against buildings is increased by 20%.
VFETribals.CornerstoneDef.blurb: The warriors of {0} are trained in identifying structural weakpoints, enabling them to demolish buildings with ease.

VFETribals.CornerstoneDef.label: Reverent Devotees
VFETribals.CornerstoneDef.description: Ideoligious moods and opinions are 25% stronger.
VFETribals.CornerstoneDef.blurb: The people of {0} extol the virtues of their ideoligious teachings.

VFETribals.CornerstoneDef.label: Zealots of the Faith
VFETribals.CornerstoneDef.description: The effects of ideoligious abilities last 10% longer.
VFETribals.CornerstoneDef.blurb: The inhabitants of {0} are exceptionally vulnerable to psychological manipulation when presented with an ideoligious bent; the effects of ideoligious abilities last longer on them.

VFETribals.CornerstoneDef.label: Cousins of the Dryads
VFETribals.CornerstoneDef.description: Gauranlen trees can produce 25% more dryads.
VFETribals.CornerstoneDef.blurb: The {0} revere the symbiosis between human and dryad, tending them with more care and enabling dryad populations to bloom.

VFETribals.CornerstoneDef.label: Tenets of Power
VFETribals.CornerstoneDef.blurb: Secrets gleaned from observing the anima trees are shared among {0}, allowing their psycasters to cultivate a fraction of the mystic energies within themselves.

VFETribals.CornerstoneDef.label: Demon Slayers
VFETribals.CornerstoneDef.description: Damage against unnatural entities is increased by 20%.
VFETribals.CornerstoneDef.blurb: {0} know the weaknesses of the horrid monsters from the black ocean, and are therefore more adept at sending them back to the Void.
